intro: Morawetzia doelziana f. calva, commonly known as the hairy morawetzia, is a rare and striking plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive foliage. The plant is notable for its velvety, woolly leaves that give it a unique appearance. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
